snippet: The S.E.C. extracts its first admission of wrongdoing under a new policy. | Hiring the children of the elite is a time-tested practice in the United States. | President Obama urges regulators to move faster on rules for Wall Street. | The Fed...
abstract: The S.E.C. extracts its first admission of wrongdoing under a new policy. | Hiring the children of the elite is a time-tested practice in the United States. | President Obama urges regulators to move faster on rules for Wall Street. | The Fed identifies shortcomings in banks’ responses to stress tests.
